author: Emma
content:
In Holland we say: it isn't all gold that shines. (translated, of course ;-) )
In England they say it in almost the same way: All that glisters is not gold.
And in German it isn't any different: Es ist nicht alles Gold, was glÃ¤nzt.
Your story versus the image. There must be some truth in it. And not only in your country, I suppose. ðŸ™‚
About the image: Such uniformity, it must be artificial, enforced, created, feigned. (Are that the right words to it?) Strong choice.
It's a reflection of the whole Democratic Circus.
